answers.answer: Hi,My own thoughts about this relate to three factors:1)how comfortable is the internist with diabetes, especially complicated situations, and how successful they are managing it.2)the level of complexity of the patient's care. For example, patients on insulin pumps versus on two oral agents.3)The comfort level and preference of the patient.Many internists are very good at caring for patients with even complicated diabetes regimens, and others are not. It depends on the situation really.Hope this helps,Take care.

question: Dr Ramsetty-With the known disclosure that you are an Endocrinologist, could you share some appropriate reasons that a patient with Diabetes might choose to be under the care of an Endocrinologist rather than under the care of a doctor of Internal Medicine?
title: Endocrinologist or Internal Medicine
